info.name: create, then update a Submission
info.description: # Update an existing Submission **PRIOR TO USING, you will also need to** 1. **import the separately provided Postman Environment** 2. **populate the imported Environment's variables with your API_Key, API_Secret, Username, and Password** Then, as you step through the Requests in order, you will: - Authenticate - Create a new Submission, omitting answers to underwriting questions - Update that same Submission, adding the answers to underwriting questions which were left out initially

exec: // capture accessToken received into an environment variable
// for use in subsequent Requests
var rsData = JSON.parse(responseBody);
postman.setEnvironmentVariable("accessToken", rsData.access_token);

request.description:
# Obtain an Access Token

Obtain a temporary access token which can be used for subsequent Requests until it expires in one hour.

exec: // capture submissionNumber returned into an environment
// variable for use in subsequent Request to update Submission
var rsData = JSON.parse(responseBody);
postman.setEnvironmentVariable("priorSubmission", rsData.SubmissionNumber);

request.description:
# Create New Submission

This route enables the creation of a new Submission.  See the provided example Request and Response bodies for more.

response.name: w/o answers to underwriting questions

exec: // capture submissionNumber returned into an environment
// variable for use in subsequent Request to update Submission
var rsData = JSON.parse(responseBody);
postman.setEnvironmentVariable("priorSubmission", rsData.SumissionNumber);

request.description:
# Update an Existing Submission

This route enables the replacement of an existing Submission with the content in the Request body.  See the provided example Request and Response bodies for more.

response.name: adding answers to underwriting questions

exec: // establish policyEffective and policyExpiration dates
// that are a little bit in the future (specifically,
// the 15th of the subsequent calendar month) so the client
// need not set these manually
var effDate = new Date();                         // initialize effDate as today
var expDate = new Date();                         // initialize expDate as today
var nextMonth = effDate.getMonth()+1;             // initialize nextMonth as current month + 1
if (nextMonth == 12) {                             // check for Dec-to-Jan cycling
nextMonth = 0;                                // reset month for Dec-to-Jan cycling
effDate.setFullYear(effDate.getFullYear()+1); // advance year for Dec-to-Jan cycling
effDate.setMonth(nextMonth);                      // advance effDate into next calendar month
effDate.setDate(15);                              // set effDate to 15th of month
expDate.setTime(effDate.getTime());               // sync expDate to new effDate
expDate.setFullYear(expDate.getFullYear()+1);     // advance expDate forward one year
postman.setGlobalVariable("policyEffectiveDate", effDate.toISOString().substr(0,10));
postman.setGlobalVariable("policyExpirationDate", expDate.toISOString().substr(0,10));
